eu.wauz.wauzcore.players.calc

Class DamageCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.players.calc.DamageCalculator

  • public class DamageCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to recalculate how much damage or heal players deal and receive. Also handles stuff like damage boni, reflection, leech and PvP-potions. Suppresses deprecation of DamageModifier, because there are currently no better alternatives.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    WauzPlayerData.getHealth()

    • Method Detail

      • attack

        public static void attack(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageByEntityEvent event)
        Determines the amount of damage a player dealt. Determines if it is normal (with boni), fixed (without boni) or magic (multiplied) damage. Checks level requirements and cooldown on the used weapon, so the attack can be cancelled and an according message can be shown. Minecraft damage modifiers are removed and replaced by custom bonuses and (crit) randomizers. In attack debug mode, the damage output is multiplied by 100. Also lets damage indicators pop up after the attack, aswell as reducing weapon durability, if necessary.
        Parameters:
        event - The damage event.
        See Also:
        applyAttackBonus(int, Player, String), removeDamageModifiers(EntityDamageEvent), EquipmentUtils.getBaseAtk(ItemStack), EquipmentUtils.getLevelRequirement(ItemStack), ValueIndicator.spawnDamageIndicator(Entity, Integer), ValueIndicator.spawnMissedIndicator(Entity), DurabilityCalculator.damageItem(Player, ItemStack, boolean), WauzDebugger.toggleAttackDebugMode(Player)

      • reflect

        public static void reflect(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageByEntityEvent event)
        Determines the amount of damage a player reflects. If the player is blocking, the attacker and themselve are thrown back slightly.
        Parameters:
        event - The damage event.
        See Also:
        EquipmentUtils.getReflectionDamage(ItemStack), SkillUtils.callPlayerFixedDamageEvent(Player, Entity, double)

      • defend

        public static void defend(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent event)
        Determines the amount of damage a player takes, with a minimum of 1. If a shield is used, damage is reduced by 60% and the minimum damage is set to 0. The player can also evade damage by having either invisibility, defense debug mode enabled or simply high agility. Also lets damage indicators pop up after the attack, aswell as reducing armor / shield durability and adding no-damage-ticks, if necessary.
        Parameters:
        event - The damage event.
        See Also:
        applyDefendBonus(int, Player), EquipmentUtils.getBaseDef(ItemStack), ValueIndicator.spawnDamageIndicator(Entity, Integer), ValueIndicator.spawnEvadedIndicator(Entity), EquipmentUtils.getBaseDef(ItemStack), DurabilityCalculator.damageItem(Player, ItemStack, boolean), WauzDebugger.toggleDefenseDebugMode(Player)

      • heal

        public static void heal(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityRegainHealthEvent event)
        Determines the amount of healing a player receives. Spawns a heal indicator afterwards.
        Parameters:
        event - The heal event.
        See Also:
        ValueIndicator.spawnHealIndicator(org.bukkit.Location, int)

      • kill

        public static void kill(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDeathEvent event)
        Handles health or mana leech, when a player kills an entity.
        Parameters:
        event - The death event.
        See Also:
        EquipmentUtils.getEnhancementOnKillHP(ItemStack), EquipmentUtils.getEnhancementOnKillMP(ItemStack)

      • removeDamageModifiers

        public static void removeDamageModifiers(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent event)
        Removes the Minecraft damage modifiers from an event.
        Parameters:
        event - The damage event.

      • setHealth

        public static void setHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                             int hp)
        Sets the new health of a player. Handles value overflows and health restore after death. Updates the action bar afterwards.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that gets their health set.
        hp - The new amount of health.

      • applyAttackBonus

        private static int applyAttackBonus(int damage,
                                    org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    java.lang.String weaponType)
        Applies attack bonuses to a damage value, based on weapon and passive skills. Also has a chance to increse the weapon skill. Increases the damge to 150%, if the player has a strength status effect.
        Parameters:
        damage - The damage value.
        player - The player that is attacking.
        weaponType - The weapon that the player uses.
        Returns:
        The new damage value.
        See Also:
        PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getSwordSkill(Player), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getAxeSkill(Player), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getStaffSkill(Player), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getAgility(Player), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getStrength(Player), PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getManaStatpoints(Player)

      • applyDefendBonus

        private static int applyDefendBonus(int resist,
                                    org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Applies defense bonuses to a resist value, based on strength bonus and pet absorption.
        Parameters:
        resist - The resist value.
        player - The player that gets attacked.
        Returns:
        The new resist value.
        See Also:
        PlayerPassiveSkillConfigurator.getStrengthFloat(Player), PlayerConfigurator.getCharacterPetAbsorption(Player, int)

      • hasPvPProtection

        public static boolean hasPvPProtection(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Checks if a player has a pvp protection effect.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to check.
        Returns:
        If the player has a pvp protection effect.
        See Also:

      • decreasePvPProtection

        public static void decreasePvPProtection(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Decreases the pvp protection time for a player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to decrease the protection time for.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerData.decreasePvPProtection()

      • increasePvPProtection

        public static void increasePvPProtection(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEvent event)
        Increases the pvp protection time for a player, based on a potion interaction. This status effect increase, shares the cooldown for food effects.
        Parameters:
        event - The interact event.
        See Also:
        Cooldown.playerFoodConsume(Player), ItemUtils.getPvPProtection(ItemStack)
